skill.name: data-storytelling
skill.description: Transform data into compelling narratives using visualization, context, and persuasive structure. Use when presenting analytics to stakeholders, creating data reports, or building executive presentations.
skill.summary: Transform data into compelling narratives using visualization, context, and persuasive structure. Us...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: Pure markdown guidance skill containing only narrative frameworks, templates, and writing techniques. No executable code, file access, network activity, or system permissions present. Safe for all users.

content.user_title: Craft data stories that drive decisions
content.value_statement: Data insights often fail to move stakeholders without a clear narrative. This skill provides structures and templates to turn metrics into persuasive stories that inspire action.
actual_capabilities: Provides narrative arc and story structure guidance with setup, conflict, resolution framework
Offers three data story frameworks: problem-solution, trend story, and comparison story
Includes visualization techniques like progressive reveal, contrast, and annotation
Supplies presentation templates for executive summaries and one-page dashboard stories
Gives headline formulas, transition phrases, and uncertainty handling examples
limitations: Does not generate charts, graphs, or visualizations
Requires user to supply accurate metrics and business context
Does not validate statistical significance or causality claims
No automated slide or document file creation capability

use_cases.title: Executive update story
use_cases.description: Turn quarterly metrics into a concise narrative for leadership presentations

use_cases.title: Investor narrative
use_cases.description: Frame traction data into a persuasive story for investor updates

use_cases.title: Insight report
use_cases.description: Structure data reports with clear findings, implications, and actions

prompt_templates.title: Simple data story
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the problem-solution framework to tell a story about churn. Here are the metrics: churn 8.5 percent, industry average 5 percent, 500 customers left last quarter.

prompt_templates.title: Trend narrative
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a trend story for Q4 performance. Include hook, context, key insight, and recommendation. Metrics: MRR grew from 1.2M to 1.6M, trial to paid conversion from 8 to 15 percent.

prompt_templates.title: Comparison decision
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a comparison story for EMEA vs APAC market expansion. Use weighted factors: market size 25, growth rate 30, competition 20, ease of entry 25. Provide a recommendation.

prompt_templates.title: Executive summary
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft an executive summary slide with key insight, supporting data, business implication, and budget ask. Insight: customers who complete onboarding in week one have 3x higher LTV. Budget request: 75K.

output_examples.input: Summarize our Q4 revenue story with a clear recommendation
output: Headline: Q4 revenue rose 33 percent after self-serve pricing changes
Key insight: Self-serve combined with success calls drove 3x higher expansion rate
Recommendation: Double down on hybrid model and target 1.8M MRR by Q2

best_practices: Lead with the key insight before showing supporting details
Use visuals and contrasts to highlight patterns and changes
End every story with a specific action or clear decision request
anti_patterns: Listing metrics without a narrative arc or story structure
Burying the main insight at the end of the presentation
Using technical jargon without considering audience vocabulary

faq.question: Is it compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It is a text-based guidance skill that works in any chat interface.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It does not analyze data files or produce charts. It guides structure and wording only.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my BI tools?
faq.answer: No direct integration exists. Use outputs from your BI tool as inputs to the prompts.

faq.question: How is my data handled?
faq.answer: The skill accesses no files or networks. You control what data you provide in prompts.

faq.question: What if the story feels generic?
faq.answer: Add specific metrics, audience goals, and a concrete decision to improve relevance.

faq.question: How does this compare to automated slide generators?
faq.answer: It provides narrative structure and wording guidance, not automated slide creation.
